file_content.text: What kept you? I must have lost three years off my life imagining the damage you were doing here.
Savoring every last moment of my languishing death? Get out!
There's nothing else. I really must return to my duties.
I've captured General Redrish.
General Redrish is dead.
Thirty-five years of service... sterling service. I was poised to take over as director of the Diplomatic Service....
That's all gone now, of course, thanks to you. I'm a laughing stock.
I said I took care of General Redrish.
Maybe you didn't hear me.
Oh, yes. Good for you. You did more damage here than she ever did.
Me? What'd I do?
Excuse me?
Well, for starters, you practically spelled out that you came for General Redrish's blood during her hearing.
Then you followed that performance by slaughtering some of the Voss's most revered holy figures!
What are you bawling about now?
Throwing another pity party?
The death of my distinguished career, and that's if I'm lucky.
The mess you made at the Shrine of Healing is unbelievable, and don't tell me it wasn't you.
Our intelligence personnel are working non-stop to throw the blame onto General Redrish.
Are the Voss buying it?
Is it working?
Not one bit, but without evidence to the contrary, they won't press us on the matter.
They were in league with her, guess I got carried away.
Sorry....
Just, stop. I don't want to hear your justifications. It doesn't matter.
Shut up and pay me.
Ha! Of course it is. I never expected for a moment you'd take responsibility for your actions.
Protecting you has destroyed my credibility and cost me every favor I had left.
I don't know why anyone would pay for the "aid" you rendered here, but I can't overrule a Sith Lord's wishes.
I'll leave you to your work, Ambassador.
Our business is concluded.
My work? I haven't got any work left!
Sounds like you could use it a lot more than I could.
Just keep it.
Should that be a consolation? I have no use for your blood money.
Everybody pays, Ambassador. One way or another.
Can't overrule mine either.
I've paid enough for your services!
All I can do now is wait to be removed from office and pray that a summary execution is the worst I can expect!
Then I guess we won't be seeing each other again.
I'll see myself out.
You got Darth Tormen what he wanted. That ought to count for something.
Look on the bright side.
Maybe. Maybe... I--I have to prepare. I'd like to be alone.
Umm, bye, Empire-man. Blizz hope you feel better.
Well, it's not like the Empire's got a surplus of expendable... you know what? Never mind.
Was hopin' you'd let me kill 'im, but where's the fun wringin' the life outta that sad sack?
No glory in diplomacy.
Poor Yoran....
Give them your resignation. It'll be cleaner.
Better do it yourself.
Boss give Empire-man present...? Oh, scary scary!
That was a low blow, even by my standards.
Hold up, hold up.... Hehe, okay.
Some advice.
I can't believe you just did that--oh! Oh, Yoran....
At least there's that... though it wasn't in time to minimize the damage.
More and more Gormak have begun to withdraw from Voss territory. The elder Mystic, Dokath-Ra, claims General Redrish is responsible.
People are saying she martyred herself to carry his message of peace. The Republic's basking in that rumor.
My interest in General Redrish ended with me dropping her at your door.
Not my concern.
You've fulfilled your obligation.
At least it's the last thing people will have to say about her.
She can't do any more harm.
Not if I can help it.
Preventing collateral damage isn't my department.
Public relations is your job.
It certainly could have been worse--so, I'll consider the losses more than acceptable.
Things will turn around once she's smuggled offworld and interrogated.
With her body in our possession, orchestrating a less favorable explanation for her death shouldn't be too difficult.
Not a light touch, are you? Meddling in all manner of affairs... I'm still unraveling the knots.
Still, Darth Serevin is happy, and Darth Tormen will be too by the look of it.
I hear Darth Serevin has kept you busy, at great cost to my nerves, but at least you've been successful.
You're back! I hadn't heard one word since you left for the trials. I thought she'd got the best of you.
I suppose no news is good news in this case. If you'd raised any suspicion capturing her, I'd have heard about it.
Whatever General Redrish's plans were, it seems we've avoided the fallout.
I'm sure my payment will reflect the extra care.
What's that worth to you?
Chasing her was like running through a mine field.
She didn't make it easy.
Debating her wasn't much different... but arguably less deadly.
Your confidence in my abilities is flattering.
That your idea of praise?
I had every right to be concerned; it was my neck on the line if anything went awry.
It's a shame my funds are so depleted or I'd see you well-compensated for your discretion.
Here are the credits Darth Tormen ordered prepared. Your loyal service to the Empire has been appreciated.
The Empire's credits are always welcome.
A pleasure doing business.
Just doing what I'm paid to do.
Don't mention it.
Not by the looks of it.
Hardly worth my time.
I'm sorry you don't approve. You're welcome to take the matter up with Darth Tormen himself.
I'll be sure to send him word of your success promptly. Farewell.
I suppose you deserve a little something for handling things discreetly.
Here, the credits Darth Tormen promised, plus a little extra thanks from the Diplomatic Service.
This is the most relieved I've felt in months. I might even actually sleep tonight.
Take this, with my gratitude. It'll complement the sum of credits Darth Tormen sent quite nicely.
Your gratitude is appreciated, Ambassador.
Pleasure doing business.
Glad to help.
It's no less than I deserved.
You'll get no argument from me.
I'll send word of your success to Darth Tormen promptly. Farewell.
Hunter, have you returned--never mind, it doesn't matter. Whatever you're doing, stop. I need you here immediately.
I can move as soon as you give me a destination.
Where is "here"?
I'm at the assembly hall, on recess from our hearing.
And I need you to take a deep breath, so let's start there.
Hey, calm down.
I have every reason to be in hysterics. General Redrish has something up her sleeve and whatever it is involves you!
Say please.
Don't boss me around.
I don't have time for your antics!
The Voss have agreed to hear the accusations I've made against General Redrish, but they've also agreed to her request to face her accuser.
She named you specifically to be called to account and submit to questioning!
I've got nothing to hide.
I'll handle it.
Definitely sounds like she's up to something.
That's probably bad.
She'll likely make a spectacle of you, but we don't have much choice.
I'm not getting paid to put up with this garbage.
Forget it.
If you don't show, the Voss will likely dismiss our grievances. Do you want General Redrish or not?
Don't make me regret this, Ambassador.
Guess I have no choice.
That would only make us even....
I'll do it if you stop crying.
Give me a reason not to just shoot her when I get there.
Make this worth it, or else.
You may have me over a barrel, bounty hunter, but remember: You can only bleed me for so much.
Extortion? Really? I thought you were a professional.
I'll pay your "protection" money if you just get here and behave yourself.
This is the assembly hall's location. Hurry, I don't want the Voss to think we're stalling.
I'm very busy, bounty hunter. At least attempt to search for the Republic forces before burdening me any further.
Are you the contact Darth Tormen sent me to talk to?
Calm down and get to business.
I'm the one who got saddled with the burden of being your minder, yes.
Darth Serevin had an offer for me. Sith get to cut in line.
I had to meet a Sith Lord.
He what? You didn't mention your arrangement with Darth Tormen, did you? The last thing this situation needs is two powerful Lords of the Sith stamping on each other's interests.
I don't generally discuss my business with outside parties.
My work is confidential.
Keep it that way. We'll all be the better for it.
If he's aware of my contract with Tormen, he never mentioned it.
It didn't come up.
I don't find that reassuring. He's a man with a long shadow... just keep mum on the subject.
You make it sound like Serevin has a conflict of interest.
You think he'll be a problem?
The only conflicts are personal. You could say they don't like one another, hate more like. Passionately.
I'm getting real tired of people telling me what I can and can't do.
Don't start with me.
Let it be an indication of how serious things are here, please keep your temper in line.
You came promptly, thank the stars. The less time you spend mixing with the locals, the better.
I trust my aide was quite explicit in informing you of the need for discretion here.
I'm aware of your concerns, Ambassador.
He was thorough.
You haven't heard half of my concerns, bounty hunter, but this business with you is at the top of the list.
I couldn't get him to shut up about it.
Against my protests.
I told him if there was any confusion on the matter, he'd be taking the Step of Harmony.
I'll stay out of trouble.
I have my doubts; your reputation precedes you.
I decide how I handle my jobs.
That's my call, not yours.
Well, if you do decide to blast your way through Voss-Ka, do me the courtesy of starting here.
That said, I look forward to being rid of General Redrish. That woman will be the death of me... if you aren't.
I was told I'd be dealing with a Kuati noble, not a Republic general.
My mark is a general?
They are one and the same. General Thelonia Redrish is a well-respected member of Kuati aristocracy, a philanthropist and a revolutionary.
What's she doing that's causing you so much grief?
How so?
That woman's charm has stalled an entire team of my most skilled negotiators for months now.
Enough with the doom and gloom. I'm not here to listen to you whine.
You're a real downer.
Perhaps plotting the general's undoing will put me in a better mood.
The Empire has lost a number of newly conquered worlds due to her interference, and we may well lose this one unless she's removed.
Unfortunately, we're going to have to take the roundabout course. Push her into the open.
Any persons or interests she'd have a personal stake in protecting?
What are her weaknesses?
The caliber of targets I deal with usually take some groundwork to get to.
I do roundabout all the time.
Good. Then I've got an idea where you can start.
How about you tell me where to point my gun and I get out of your hair?
I prefer the direct approach.
As much as I'd love that, we must be discreet.
Imperial Intelligence suspects that she's behind the guerilla attacks on our forces here, but we can't prove it.
I believe your best course of action would be to root out General Redrish's officers in the field and gather evidence of her involvement.
You have names? Whereabouts?
Where do I start?
You're telling me I can't touch her, but I can shoot up her officers?
Won't that anger the Voss?
You can't touch her here. Out in the wilderness, away from prying eyes, anything could happen.
My job is to deal with General Redrish, not clean up after her.
That'll cost extra.
Fine, here. I spend enough of my hours haggling without having to do it with you.
I'm afraid casualty reports are all we have to go on. You'll have to search around the ambush points for signs of the enemy.
Take this holorecorder. If you make any discoveries, transmit the evidence to my frequency.
Will do.
If you insist, but I'll want copies for my scrapbook.
I'll practice my photography.
For my own sanity, I'm going to pretend you're taking this seriously.
What a waste of my talents.
Keeping a low profile, for once, isn't going to kill you.
